data.title: Senior Software Engineer
data.description:
Senior Software Engineer / Nashua, NH

Company Overview: Our client is a dynamic robotics startup based in Nashua, NH, dedicated to pushing the boundaries of autonomous systems and robotics technology. Their mission is to develop innovative solutions that drive the future of robotics across various industries, including manufacturing, logistics, and healthcare.

Position Summary: Our client is seeking a talented Senior Software Engineer with strong proficiency in C++ and extensive experience in embedded systems development to join our growing team. As a key member of their engineering team, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and optimizing software for our cutting-edge robotic systems.

Responsibilities

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement software solutions for robotic control systems and embedded platforms. Develop and maintain robust, scalable, and efficient C++ codebase for real-time embedded applications. Architect, optimize, and troubleshoot software components for performance, reliability, and safety-critical operations. Implement software modules for sensor integration, motion planning, navigation algorithms, and machine vision. Conduct code reviews, write unit tests, and ensure code quality and documentation standards are met. Work closely with hardware engineers to integrate software with embedded systems and peripheral devices. Participate in system integration, testing, and validation of robotic prototypes and production systems. 

Qualifications

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Robotics, or related field. 5+ years of professional experience in software development with a focus on C++ programming for embedded systems. Strong understanding of real-time operating systems (RTOS), embedded Linux, or bare-metal programming. Proficiency in software development tools and methodologies (version control, CI/CD, Agile practices). Experience with robotics frameworks and libraries (ROS, OpenCV, PCL) is a plus. Familiarity with hardware interfaces (UART, SPI, I2C) and sensor integration (IMUs, LiDAR, cameras). Excellent problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and ability to work independently and in a team environment. Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with multidisciplinary teams. 

The Offer

Opportunity to work on groundbreaking robotics projects with a passionate and innovative team. Collaborative and dynamic startup environment where your contributions directly impact the success of the company. Competitive compensation package with benefits and opportunities for professional growth and career advancement. 

How to Apply: Please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience and why you are interested in this position. We look forward to hearing from you!

Posted By: Christina Carboni

data.title: Senior Systems Engineer
data.description:
Job Description Summary As a Senior Systems Engineer, you will join GE Systems Power Generation team and provide the technical leadership that enables innovation, engineering excellence, and quality as we meet the transforming demands of our customers, while delivering the performance and reliability that our users demand.

At GE Aviation in Dayton, OH the EPISCenter is the headquarters for all of Aviation Power Engineering. At this facility you have an opportunity to put your engineering training and skills to use. Our Engineers are focused and challenged on developing new technologies and delivering state of the art products such as Hybrid Electric aircraft, the latest military platforms, and SiC technology to name a few. Plus, if you like hands-on work, there is also a 155,000 sq ft lab that includes 6 high power test cells totaling 15 MW, an EMI chamber, an electronics lab, a rapid build prototype lab, and a real time simulator lab with all the latest equipment. Job Description 

Roles And Responsibilities

The Senior Systems Engineer will be leading systems development efforts for new product introductions. The primary responsibilities include the following:

Work closely with Design and Systems Teams to confirm full specification compliance and drive timely problem report resolutions.Work closely with Project and Program Manager to ensure program/project plan is developed and executed properly.Implement robust requirements management practices, employing industry-standard tools and methodologies to maintain traceability and manage changes throughout the project lifecycle.Conduct thorough system analysis to identify potential risks, dependencies, and integration challenges, proposing innovative solutions to optimize system performance and reliability.Requirements elicitation, derivation, and decomposition to lower-level subsystems and components.Coordination with customers to work through specification derivation questions.Test execution and procedure development that will demonstrate compliance to specifications.Troubleshoot system failures and performance issues and coordinate with other development roles.Serve as a primary technical liaison to bridge communication between customers and internal technical teams.

Role

The Senior Systems Engineer will also work with the broader organization in delivering to shared vision and goals and, as such, will play a central role in several engineering activities including:

Participate in LEAN engineering activities such as release planning, concept and technical design reviews, and LEAN events.Ensure cross-system dependencies and system integration activities are addressed in the program plan.Ensure projects are supported through entire life-cycle from conception to post-launch.Explain difficult or sensitive information and promote agreement using clear and accessible language.Coach system engineers and engineering team members.Assist in Model-Based Systems Engineering activities to support development of system models.

Required Qualifications

Bachelor's degree from an accredited university or college.A minimum of 5 years of experience in Systems Engineering role.A minimum of 10 years of experience in an engineering role.This role requires use of technical data subject to U.S. Government contract restrictions and this posting is only for U.S. Citizens. GE will require proof of status.

 Desired Characteristics 

Proven track record in systems engineering, with a strong emphasis on electrical power systems in the aerospace sector.Excellent communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.Model-Based Systems Engineering Experience.Aerospace industry experience.High degree of demonstrated accountability to program deliverables, including quality, reliability, performance, and cost.Proven ability to manage risk and uncertainty for self and team within a dynamic priority-setting environment.Strong technical acumen paired with the ability to understand a wide range of technology domains including data communication protocols.Experience in DO-178c and DO-254 processes for developing software and complex electronic hardware.Experience in executing DO-160 tests, including the development of comprehensive test procedures.Experience in executing MIL-STD-160 tests, including the development of comprehensive test procedures.Proficient in managing requirements using both DOORS Classic and DOORS Next Generation platforms.MATLAB / Simulink experience.

Some Of Our Competitive Benefits Package Includes

Medical, dental, and vision insurance that begins on the first day of employmentPermissive time off policy for newly hired employeesGenerous 401(k) planTuition ReimbursementLife insurance and disability coverageAnd more!

This role requires access to U.S. export-controlled information. If applicable, final offers will be contingent on ability to obtain authorization for access to U.S. export-controlled information from the U.S. Government.

 Additional Information

data.title: Senior Controls Engineer
data.description:
Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Lorven Technologies, Inc., is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!

Position: Senior Controls Engineer

Location: Greenville, SC

Duration: Long term contract

Job Description:

Key Responsibilities:

The CS Senior Controls Engineer supports installations and commissioning of material distribution systems both new and retrofit. Provides a high-level understanding and knowledge of all aspects of assigned projects and associated software. Supports onsite installation teams with in-depth knowledge of equipment, technologies, and system software. Oversees multiple controls projects simultaneously, focusing on ensuring individual project teams are applying the correct engineering principles and concepts.

Core Task:

Provide remote and onsite support of high level and complex automation systemsAssist in developing and maintaining a standardized code set that can be used across multiple implementationsResponsible for application engineering of HMI, VFD, and PLC systems for fully automated warehouse systemsOversee the development of multiple controls projects simultaneously, ensuring all projects are on track financially and for an on-time deploymentCollaborate with engineering and sales teams to design and quote automation systems and system improvementsDevelop system documentation and provide documented PLC code for internal resources and external customersResponsible for scratch development of PLC, VFD, and HMI programsSubject matter expert in multiple Swisslog technologies and/or customers; able to support customers and junior members with this knowledgeLead multiple on-site project teams throughout the installation of a project to a successful implementation

Essential

Educational / Professional Qualifications

BS degree in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science /or equivalent experience in the field of electrical/controls engineering 

Desirable

MS degree in Electrical Engineering or Computer ScienceSiemens or Allen Bradley programming certifications

Essential

Necessary Experience

10+ years industrial experience with sound knowledge of standard programming platformsExtensive experience with Siemens Step 7 Classic, TIA Portal, and Rockwell programming softwareExtensive experience with PLC programming languages such as ladder, FBD, STL, and SCLPrior experience leading controls teams on new or retrofit projectsKnowledgeable on PLC and HMI programming best practicesApplication knowledge of warehouse distribution systems (pallet or tote conveyor, storage and retrieval machines, monorail systems, etc)

Desirable

Siemens Certified Programmer - SIMATIC S7 with STEP7 v5Siemens Certified Programmer - SIMATIC S7 with TIA PortalExperience with Industrial Ethernet and modern field buses (PROFIBUS, ASi, DeviceNET, etc),Experience with the following VFD OEMs: SEW, Siemens, Allen Bradley, Schneider, or Kuka

Essential

Required knowledge, skills, and abilities

Practical experience of electrical / controls engineering & electrical installationsAbility to creates controls designs from scratch as well as debug existing PLC code complex issuesExcellent word processing and spreadsheet skillsShows ownership and pride in craftsmanship/projectsKnowledge of electrical/mechanical standard and best practicesFamiliarity mentoring junior members

Desirable

EPLAN or AutoCAD-E familiarity or experienceExperience with industrial Wireless networks, protocols, and devices

Travel:

Travel as required to support projects, including weekends and potentially holidays

data.title: Senior Mechanical Engineer
data.description:
Job Title: Senior Mechanical EngineerLocations: Chicago, ILDuration: Full Time, Permanent & Onsite

Job DescriptionWHO YOU AREYour qualifications and experience are impressive. You’re established in your field with at least 10 to 20 years of mechanical experience under your belt. You have your bachelor’s degree in engineering. A PE license is required. (But much more depending upon the profile at first)You know buildings. You have advanced knowledge of: ASHRAE standards and building codes, coordination between design disciplines, project scope development, ventilation, humidity control, load calculations, and duct/piping sizing techniques; air handlers, pumps, chillers, boilers (both steam and hot water), temperature controls, ductwork accessories, heat exchangers and tanks, and sustainable design (LEED, energy codes, etc.). You have knowledge of and are comfortable with renovation designs of historic buildings. You’re also knowledgeable in key architectural, electrical, plumbing, and fire protection considerations as they relate to mechanical systems. General knowledge of construction cost.You are proficient with relevant business and engineering applications. You’re skilled in both Microsoft Office and Project, Google docs and have working knowledge of CAD methods and procedures. You’re also comfortable with HVAC calculation software tools.

WHAT YOU'LL DOYou’ll be a key member of our Chicago Public Schools team. You’ll attend weekly meetings and share your engineering expertise on behalf of the owner for all MEP issues at CPS schools.You’ll solve problems. You’ll visit school sites to develop design solutions, and you’ll contact building engineers and manufacturer representatives to resolve emergent equipment issues.You’ll develop design packages for implementation by independent AE firms. You’ll also provide oversight to other AE firms and perform technical design reviews to ensure compliance with CPS standards.You’ll enjoy what you do. You’ll have flexibility to work remotely, work with great people, continue to learn and grow, and have a good time doing it.




Thanks & Regards,Daniel S (Saiyed)Executive Recruiterdaniel.s@brightpathassociates.com

You will partner with Engineering leaders, Design, Product, QA, and business teams to build and deliver high-quality, scalable, and flexible software solutions. You'll have the ability to mentor more junior to mid level engineers.We aim to foster an Engineering culture that emphasizes full-stack development teams empowered to make as many decisions as possible in their technical direction and processes.

data.title: Senior Engineer – IT Infrastructure
data.description:
Phoenix, AZ company is seeking a Senior Engineer – IT Infrastructure to join their team for a contract opportunity.

Leverage the latest technology to solve business problems in a collaborative environment at this Fortune 500 transportation giant. Top technical resources are retained on long-term contract engagements. Responsible for leveraging cutting edge technology to solve business problems by participating in all phases of the development process from inception through transition, advocating the agile process and test-driven development, using object-oriented development tools to analyze, model, design, construct and test reusable objects, and making the codebase better.

Contract Duration: 6 Month contract to hire

Onsite Hybrid: Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday

Required Skills & Experience

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Computer Engineering, Technology, Information Systems (CIS/MIS), Engineering or related technical discipline, or equivalent experience/training. 3 years of experience as a network or infrastructure engineer or administrator. 3 years LINUX (RHEL8) experience, IBM WebSphere Application Server, IBM HTTP Server, IBM Cognos and IBM Cloud or MS Azure. 

Desired Skills & Experience

Master’s degree in computer science computer engineering, Technology, Information Systems (CIS/MIS), Engineering or related technical discipline, or equivalent experience/training. 5 years of experience as a network or infrastructure engineer or administrator. Advanced ability to plan strategically for current and future business environments, including future technology and business design changes to create flexible, scalable solutions. In-depth knowledge of IT business operations, systems requirements, and processes. Ability to analyze complex problems and implement solutions and/or workarounds. Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously with a keen desire to learn and expand depth of knowledge. Ability to thrive in a sense-of-urgency environment and leverage best practices. Demonstrated initiative, flexibility, and ability to adapt to changing priorities and work environments. Proficiency in Agile project management methodology, specifically within infrastructure area. Knowledge and hands on experience with FTP and secure FTP. Experience in working with IBM WebSphere/Tomcat/IBM Http Server and IBM Cognos Reporting Server. Knowledge and understanding on SSL certificates, PGP encryption and NAS storages. Knowledge and support of Dynatrace and Splunk tools installations. Knowledge and work experience on various components like Kubernetes, VPC, subnets, CI/CD in IBM Cloud/MS Azure. Shell and Perl scripting capability knowledge in respect to setting up monitoring and alerting for Unix/Linux systems. 

What You Will Be Doing

Provide good understanding of concepts related to server load balancing, WAS clustering, and other application scaling concepts. Troubleshoot and resolve middleware issues across development, testing, and production environments. Recommend and implement system enhancements that will improve the performance and reliability of the systems including installing, upgrading/patching, monitoring, problem resolution, and configuration management. Encourage an environment of sharing and teamwork among the team. Stay current with systems technology best practices and changing technologies, in order to maintain domain expertise and recommend enhancements or changes. Support communication and response process by responding to users on system issues, maintenance, and system status, and advising and escalating on any prolonged or major issues. Travel, as required. Mandatory rotational schedule for on-call off-hours support. 

Posted By: Cate Novak

data.title: Senior Test Engineer
data.description:
Eaton’s ES AMER ESS division is currently seeking a Senior Test Engineer.

The expected annual salary range for this role is $80250.03 - $117700.04 a year.

Please note the salary information shown above is a general guideline only. Salaries are based upon candidate skills, experience, and qualifications, as well as market and business considerations.

What You’ll Do

Specify, design, build, debug, validate and deploy the computer-automated test systems and processes to be used in manufacturing and subcontractor facilities. Collaborate with design engineers to ensure design for test concepts are incorporated during the development phase. Generate and implement complete test plans based on knowledge of the product and experience with test methodologies and capabilities in multiple locations. Develop final-assembly functional test equipment and procedures for global deployment, as well as functional test equipment for external suppliers and value-adding partners. Develop functional test equipment and procedures, and sub-assembly functional test equipment and procedures. Conduct fault insertion and analysis to determine the equipment's test comprehensiveness, and makes accessible the test Failure Mode Effects Analysis (FMEA)and trouble-shooting procedures. Implement statistical process control on the recorded test data. Collects data from the test fixtures and makes the test data available to the Quality team member for analysis, and to other team members as required to meet project success factors. Train test operators to understand the test process and to utilize and maintain test equipment. Drive continuous improvement for all test processes. Initiate and manage capital projects for test equipment, test facility enhancements and new product start-ups. Implement Engineering Changes to enhance product quality (updates test equipment, software and hardware changes). Reduce cycle time and cost by applying “Lean Manufacturing” techniques. Maintain test documentation and equipment to meet ISO 9001 (including equipment calibration). Develop and implements test strategies to insure product specifications are achieved throughout production. Lead Electrical Safety implementations. 


Qualifications

Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science or similar engineering degrees from an accredited educational institution. Minimum of 3 years experience in electrical testing and designing automated test equipment and test processes 


Preferred Qualifications

Master’s Degree in Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering Knowledge of communication protocols including GPIB, RS-232 Knowledge of National Electrical Code Safety Requirements Knowledge of industry and customer specific quality processes (i.e., ISO9001 etc.) Experience with Lean Manufacturing and Six Sigma methodology Technical understanding of product and end user application/specifications, including product testing requirements Knowledge of C++, Visual Basic and LabView are desired, SQL, Acess, Active Server Pages, Faststand Knowledge of communication protocols: CAN, I2C, and JTAG 


Skills

Ability to demonstrate knowledge of test software Successful execution as both an individual contributor and team member. Ability to read schematics and interpret the behavior of electronic systems by the operation of embedded code and Digital Signal Processors (DSP) controls. Ability to demonstrate problem solving using logic and methods to solve difficult problems with effective solutions Ability to demonstrate excellent communication and interpersonal skills Position requires an individual who is self-motivated, self-managed, team-oriented, proactive, attentive to detail, task oriented, and able to overcome obstacles to meet schedule requirements. 


We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law.

Eaton considers qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with local laws. To request a disability-related reasonable accommodation to assist you in your job search, application or interview process, please call us at 1-800-836-6345 to discuss your specific need. Only accommodation requests will be accepted by this phone number.

We know that good benefit programs are important to employees and their families. data.title: Senior Quality Engineer
data.description:
Eaton’s IS AER FED division is currently seeking a Senior Quality Engineer. This is an onsite role based at our Jackson, MI location.

The expected annual salary range for this role is $80250.03 - $117700.04 a year. This position is also eligible for a variable incentive program.

Please note the salary information shown above is a general guideline only. Salaries are based upon candidate skills, experience, and qualifications, as well as market and business considerations.

What You’ll Do

Functionally responsible for designing, developing, coordinating, and deploying work instructions/procedures and associated process controls for the assigned HPWT. Develop robust root cause and corrective actions for non-conformities leading to customer escapes, internal rework, and scrap. Develops process improvements and cost control programs in their HPWT. Reviews customer/industry/internal specifications to ensure compliance with stated requirements. Provides technical support to operations, customers, and suppliers. Provides training/mentoring in quality toolbox.

Essential Responsibilities

 Acts as a primary organizational contact for customer concerns and ensure appropriate corrective actions are deployed as necessary using 8D, 5-Why, and lean tools while driving a Zero-defect mindset. Achieves goals associated with the quality engineering team that are aligned with the Quality Department and Jackson Plant. Prioritizes quality engineering activities to assure top priorities are focused on key objectives of quality, cost, and delivery. Reviews customer/industry/internal specifications to ensure compliance with stated requirements. Provides technical support to operations, customers, and suppliers as required. Assures that product shipped meets internal and external customer requirements. Communicates quality issues to front line leaders, factory personnel, and customers. Assist them in root cause and permanent corrective action. Directs the disposition and analysis of returned material and internal non-conforming product. Ensure that actions around top pareto items are identified and completed. Supports organizational readiness for customer and other Third-party assessments related to the product or process. Host Customer and Third-Party Inspectors/Auditors as required. Supports the deployment and maintenance of Eaton Business System tools, where appropriate or required, to improve Quality Management System effectiveness (i.e., QLI/QBP, EZDP, EQMS, ELSS, WISPER, MESH, GEMBA, Leaders Standard Work, STOP Cards, etc.). Develops and deploy pFMEAs and Control Plans per AIAG standard. Formulates and implement quality assurance procedures, policies, and standards. Ensure these documents align with the recognized Aerospace Quality System Standard as well as Eaton Objectives, Policies and Procedures. Manages assigned customer portals and customer scorecards to ensure actions are being completed and customer requirements are being met. Leads and/or provide technical advice and counsel to cross-functional teams assigned to continuous improvement, problem solving, and product development. Provides technical guidance to less experienced Quality Engineers especially on quality toolbox and continuous improvement concepts. Supports product transition needs as required. Completes assignments with minimal oversight. Completes other duties as assigned


Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree from accredited institution.Minimum 2 years’ experience in a manufacturing environment. All applicants must be U.S. persons within the meaning of ITAR. ITAR defines a U.S. person as a U.S. citizen, U.S. Permanent Resident (i.e., Green Card Holder'), Political Asylee, or Refugee.No relocation benefit is being offered for this position. Only candidates that currently reside within the immediate geographical area of 50 of Jackson, MI will be considered.Legally authorized to work in the United States without company sponsorship now or in the future.


Preferred

Ability to communicate effectively with all levels of the organization.The ideal candidate would have 2-5 years of experience in a quality engineering role.Microsoft Office application (e.g. Word, Excel, PowerPoint, OneNote, etc.) experience.Read and understand Blue Prints, Specifications, and Requirements.Knowledge of quality assurance systems (e.g. AS9100, ISO 9001, TS16949, IATF 16949).Knowledge of assembly operations and inspection measuring & test equipment.Expertise in problem solving tools and techniques (8D, A3, 3-Legged 5 Why, and Ishikawa Cause and Effect).Experienced in use of continuous improvement lean manufacturing principles and scrap reduction tools (5S+, Value Stream Mapping, PDCA, Standard Work, and Poka-Yoke).Experienced in use of AIAG quality tools to reduce variability and mitigate risk (APQP, PPAP, FMEA, Control Plan, MSA, and SPC). Job Description :
At our company, we believe in creating opportunities for aspiring people to thrive and achieve ambitious goals. That’s why a career at our company is more than a job. It is an opportunity to be part of a diverse and engaged community of professionals, to be treated as a respected and valued member of a motivated team and to be empowered to do exceptional work that advances the best interest of everyone involved. We recognize the importance of creating a work environment that is both rewarding to our employees and supportive of our unwavering commitment to provide unparalleled service to our clients.
PurposeEvaluate, select and apply standard engineering techniques, procedures and criteria on moderately complex projects. 
Key Responsibilities:
Leadership and Direction 
Receive broad guidance relating to overall key objectives, critical issues, new concepts, and policy matters and broad parameters for execution. Receive direction as needed, and especially on highly complex assignments. Independently apply extensive and diversified knowledge of engineering principles and practices in broad areas of assignments and related fields. Review work produced by staff for quality assurance. 
At the Operational and Company Level 
Assist with the marketing of the firm’s capabilities to establish new clients and enhance relationships with existing clients. Work closely with other disciplines on multi-discipline projects. 
Do the Work 
Use advanced techniques, theory precepts and practices in the civil engineering field and related sciences and disciplines. Serve as liaison between clients and agencies, subcontractors, and design teams on complex project issues. Make design recommendations, adaptations, and modifications. Plan, schedule, conduct, and/or coordinate detailed phases of assigned project work. Carry out complex or novel assignments requiring the development of new or improved civil engineering techniques or procedures to create new or refined equipment, materials, processes or methods. Create own design work using computer-aided or manual drafting techniques. Prepare reports and correspondence concerning the direction of projects. Perform field investigation or inspections. Conduct constructability reviews or assist in the design/plan/review of other civil engineering projects. Review plans and prepare/review technical specifications, contract documents, and estimates. 
Education, Work Experience, Licensure/Certifications, and Technical Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering or related field required.PE license strongly preferred Five or more (5+) years of experience in civil engineering, land development industry or related industry experience strongly preferred. Demonstrated proficiency with computer applications and civil engineering design software such as Civil3D. Familiarity with reading construction plans. Basic understanding of financial reports and metrics. Data analysis and interpretation skills. Thorough understanding of business and financial principles in a consulting business. Must hold a valid state driver’s license and successfully pass a motor vehicle check. 
Physical Demands and Working Environment
Primarily indoor professional office environment, which can consist of possible bright/dim light, noise, fumes, odors, and traffic. Mobility around an office environment. Some outdoor work environment and may be exposed to outside weather conditions, varying temperatures, excessive noise, and/or potential hazards. Mobility around a job/construction site to include walking, bending, crawling, climbing, squatting, or kneeling and wearing of required Personal Protective Equipment (PPE). Frequent and prolonged use of standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines. Occasional lifting or carrying up to 20 pounds. Occasional pushing or pulling up to 20 pounds. Occasional reaching outward or above shoulder. 
Note: While this job description is intended to be an accurate reflection of the job requirements, it is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Management reserves the right to modify, add, or remove duties from particular jobs and to assign other duties as necessary at any time with or without notice.

data.title: Senior Plant Engineer
data.description:
Type: Direct Hire Location: Philadelphia, PASalary: $136k - $150k 
The Senior Plant Engineer is responsible for the operation and optimization of the equipment, systems and utilities of a cGMP Cell Therapy Manufacturing Facility. Collaborate with Maintenance and Metrology groups to develop programs for equipment maintenance and calibrations. Coordinate with the Facilities, Engineering, Operations and Quality teams to ensure maximum uptime and efficiency of all systems and equipment.
Primary ResponsibilitiesSupport the design, installation, start-up, commissioning, qualification and maintenance of equipment, systems and utilities associated with cGMP Manufacturing, Laboratories and Warehouse.Demonstrate a strong understanding of HVAC, controls, mechanical, electrical and utility systems, and be able to troubleshoot as necessary.Understanding of thermodynamics, psychrometric properties and HVAC/mechanical design is highly desirable.Monitor and respond to alarms generated from the BMS/QEMS, including off-hours and weekends.Responsible for launching and/or supporting technical investigations, deviations, CAPAs, etc. related to GMP facilities, utilities, and equipment.Develop and/or enhance departmental standard operating procedures.Ensure through continuous improvement and routine monitoring that equipment works to design and manufacturer’s specifications.Participate in the planning, design, budgeting, scheduling and execution of assigned projects.Establishes programs and solutions for increasing uptime and for equipment problems that affect the manufacturing process.Independently applies advanced engineering techniques and analysis and provide technical guidance to less experienced design and engineering personnel.Conduct routine inspections of premises and equipment.Oversee work performed by maintenance and/or external contractors to ensure conformance to design and industry standards.Other duties as required.
Position RequirementsBS or MS in Mechanical Engineering field is required.5 years of related BioPharma/Life Sciences experience required.Prior experience with Facilities operations in a cell therapy manufacturing facility, or experience with cell therapy manufacturing facility MEP design is highly desirable.Has comprehensive understanding of principles, theories, concepts, and industry practices and standards and their application.Extensive knowledge and experience designing/operating to ASHRAE, ISO, ISPE, SMACNA, etc. is highly desirable.Experience using Computerized Maintenance Management Software (Blue Mountain) is preferred.Experience using Building Management Systems (Siemens - Apogee/Desigo) and Environmental Monitoring Systems is preferred.Demonstrable experience with cGMP capital, maintenance, and operating projects.Prior experience using Reliability Centered Maintenance is highly desirable.Excellent oral and written communication skills required.

Including facility and heavy industrial equipment foundation structural design.Provide project and onsite construction management to ensure the requirements of the project are achieved. · The position will require an in-depth workingknowledge of current industrial facility construction practices; and a comprehensive technical understanding of applications for structural analysis / design insteel, concrete, and wood.The position also requires highly skilled competencies in technical written communications, oral presentations, customer interactions, teamworkcollaborations, and leadership.
